intro: Leucophyllum hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's redstem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed capsules that disperse its seeds effectively. Hinton's redstem is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes.
